name: Oh, no! Beta!
description: The Sony Betacam BVP-3P was a broadcast-quality camera that used Sony's Beta system, most commonly found in consumer cameras. During the Format Wars in the 1970s and 80s, Beta lost to the cheaper and more accessible Video Home System (VHS).

key_work.title: Sony Betacam BVP-3P
key_work.brief_description: Sony introduced the professional use Betacam cassette format in 1982 for the broadcast video industry. Although related to the Betamax format, its key differences were consumer orientated as it competed against VHS (Video Home System) in the videotape format wars of the period.

constellations_primary.name: Oh, no! Beta!
constellations_primary.description: The Sony Betacam BVP-3P was a broadcast-quality camera that used Sony's Beta system, most commonly found in consumer cameras. During the Format Wars in the 1970s and 80s, Beta lost to the cheaper and more accessible Video Home System (VHS).

start.title: The Simpsons
start.brief_description: Set in Springfield, the average American town, the show focuses on the antics and everyday adventures of the Simpson family; Homer, Marge, Bart, Lisa and Maggie, as well as a virtual cast of thousands. Since the beginning, the series has been a pop culture icon, attracting hundreds of celebrities to guest star. The show has also made name for itself in its fearless satirical take on politics, media and American life in general.

constellations_other.name: Migrations
constellations_other.description: Universal Everything's Migrations features fantastical creatures born from elements of other animals, just like the titles in this Constellation.

constellations_other.name: Oh, no! Beta!
constellations_other.description: The Sony Betacam BVP-3P was a broadcast-quality camera that used Sony's Beta system, most commonly found in consumer cameras. During the Format Wars in the 1970s and 80s, Beta lost to the cheaper and more accessible Video Home System (VHS).

constellations_other.name: Transformations
constellations_other.description: Like many techniques born from the visual language of magic lanterns, the dissolve effect was incorporated into filmmaking and is still used today.

constellations_other.name: Cartoon classics and criticism
constellations_other.description: A whole cavalcade of cartoons have successfully made the leap into arcades and onto consoles, but the relationship between cinema and videogames is far more likely to fizzle out.

constellations_other.name: Nadia Tass
constellations_other.description: Comedic and cult classics take centre stage in Nadia Tass' career.

end.title: Steamboat Willie
end.creator_credit: Roy O. Disney, Walt Disney and Walt Disney Productions

video_links.name: Walt Disney Animation Studios' Steamboat Willie

end.brief_description: Mickey Mouse, piloting a steamboat, delights his passenger, Minnie, by making musical instruments out of the menagerie on deck.

links.description: The Simpsons episode, ‘Itchy and Scratchy: The Movie’, features a spoof of Disney’s famous Steamboat Willie cartoon, with Itchy playing the Mickey Mouse role, but with murderous intentions and a Tommy gun.

start.title: Kingdom Hearts II
start.brief_description: Kingdom Hearts II is an action role-playing game, and the primary entry to the series since the 2002 Disney Interactive and Square collaboration.

end.title: World of Final Fantasy
end.brief_description: Two twins journey to a mysterious world to rediscover their lost memories. In this peculiar place, the young Mirage Keepers will encounter new friends and familiar Final Fantasy heroes as they learn the truth about their past.

constellations_other.name: Oh, no! Beta!
constellations_other.description: The Sony Betacam BVP-3P was a broadcast-quality camera that used Sony's Beta system, most commonly found in consumer cameras. During the Format Wars in the 1970s and 80s, Beta lost to the cheaper and more accessible Video Home System (VHS).

links.description: Kingdom Hearts brings together the Disney animated world with the Final Fantasy videogame and the main character Sora, who first appeared in Kingdom Hearts, later appeared World of Final Fantasy.

links.description: Though better quality, Betamax lost the Format War due to the accessibility and affordability of VHS. In The Simpson’s episode ‘Itchy & Scratchy: The Movie’, Snake steals a Betamax VCR only to realise, “Oh no! Beta!”, presumably because it won’t play his VHS tapes.

end.title: The Jazz Singer
end.creator_credit: Alan Crosland and Darryl F. Zanuck
end.brief_description: The Jazz Singer is a 1927 American musical drama film directed by Alan Crosland. It is the first feature-length motion picture with not only a synchronised recorded music score but also lip-synchronous singing and speech in several isolated sequences.

constellations_other.name: Oh, no! Beta!
constellations_other.description: The Sony Betacam BVP-3P was a broadcast-quality camera that used Sony's Beta system, most commonly found in consumer cameras. During the Format Wars in the 1970s and 80s, Beta lost to the cheaper and more accessible Video Home System (VHS).

constellations_other.name: Sound and Hollywood
constellations_other.description: The impact of sound on Tinsel Town stretches from the beginning of cinema to recent award-winners, as well as the biggest band in K-Pop.

links.description: It was after seeing The Jazz Singer – the first film to feature synchronised sound dialogue – that Walt Disney was inspired to put a synched soundtrack in his next cartoon – Steamboat Willie.

links.description: Disney’s iconic animation style is one of the first popular moving image cartoons. The famous company’s famous characters appear in the Kingdom Hearts videogame series, which has a level rendered in the Steamboat Willie style.
